attributes.action: Abandon the plans to make home births available to everyone by 2009
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Patricia Hewitt has comitted that by the end of 2009, every pregnant woman in England will be guaranteed the full range of choices about how and where to give birth.  This means a vast number of additional midwives and increases in cost associated with home births that will require additional help and in many cases emergency treatment.  Far better to ensure that there are adequate maternity departments in all hospitals and invest the money in ensuring that the vast majority of the population who are not pregnant get serious health problems dealt with quickly and effectively.
